results.title: The Last days work
results.brief_description: It is not just the threatening capacity of global nuclear war nor the disfiguration of natural ecological forces but rather it is the work people do that indicates the end of their use on this planet. If not destructive and wasteful in its own right modern work relies on others being so. This is a critical film essay about the final phase of work. It is built in seven parts which correspond to each day of the week.

results.title: The Last days of living
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Malca Gillson
results.brief_description: Looks at the Palliative Care Unit for the terminally ill at Montreal’s Royal Victoria Hospital, and the hardships and joys experienced by patients, their families and the staff. The palliative care techniques observed by the camera are simple and straight forward, such as listening, sharing, touching and music therapy. An essential film for health-care professionals and volunteers, and for the public at large.

results.title: The Last Crop
results.creator_credit: Billy MacKinnon, Zenith, Film Australia, Australian Film Commission, ABC-TV (Australia), Channel Four and Sue Clayton
results.brief_description: Ann cleans for a living. She shares everything she has with her two moody children and her equally erratic neighbours but she also shares everything her rich and constantly out-of-town employers have. When Ann’s not sorting out the lives of her family and friends, she’s thinking about her father’s property in the country and how nice it would be to live there. Only one little international mining company stands in her way. But Ann, used to beating the system in her own quiet way, is not about to let that spoil her plans. The dry, quirky style of this wonderfully honest film portrays Australian life in a refreshingly unfashionable way. Based on the short story by Elizabeth Jolley.

results.title: The Laser beam
results.creator_credit: Handel Film Corporation and Leo A. Handel
results.brief_description: Uses animation to explain the principle of the laser. Shows some of the applications of lasers in medicine, industry, communications, space exploration and the holograms that may lead to three-dimensional television. Traces the history of lasers and shows how emission spectra and lasers are related. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Language of film: the technique of super 8 production
results.creator_credit: Playing With Time and Kit Hood
results.brief_description: Follows a group of 12-16 year old student filmmakers through the various stages of creating their own 8mm film. Looks at three major areas: pre-production (scriptwriting, props and equipment); production (camera shots, direction, actors, assistants); and post-production (editing, sound). Narrated by Linda Schuyler. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Language of advertising (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Dibb and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Ways of seeing”.
One of a series of films by art critic and author, John Berger, which explores the ways in which we look at pictures. Shows how the images used in advertising and publicity are related to the tradition of oil painting, a connection which we fail to notice only because we are encouraged to believe that painting is fine art whereas publicity is simple commerce. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
